START TODAY
Electronic Money License in Great Britain

This article provides information about the Electronic Money Institution (EMI) — an electronic money license for a company, registered in the UK.

Depending on the turnover level, there are 2 options for registering an EMI license in the UK:
— a classic EMI, in this case the fee (duty) to the FCA will be £ 5,000;
— a small EMI (the monthly turnover should not exceed € 3,000,000; if the company do not conduct business — we will estimate according to the projections).

Timelines of registration

3 months (if the regulator — FCA, do not have any questions about the submitted application);
Up to 12 months (in case the FCA requests the additional documents).

It should be noted that the electronic money application is being implemented in general in the international regulation sphere. The companies with the electronic money can effectively offer a number of banking services and services for the client funds holding, as a rule, these services are provided online (that implies a lot of risks). Therefore, this well-organized application is just one step below the bank (if we consider this application as a financial instrument).

There are less requirements to the fund managers, stock brokers, depositories activities. For this reason, it is neccessary to know the features of the application (electronic money), all the key issues of the professional management and the attendant risks or problems and how to solve them asap.

First of all, conducting an EMI business requires the appropriate education and knowledge to manage and obtain an EMI license. It means that:
— The Senior Management must be experienced in organizing of such a type of company. This is an important fact for the FCA; persons with no experience in the field usually do not obtain a permission.
— The company must be managed from the UK.

Read more
The FCA singles out the following main points:

  • The company must have more UK resident directors (or an equal number) than foreign directors (their nationality does not matter).
  • The FCA affirms that the decisions of the Resident Director have a higher force; he may reject policies, strategies and decisions that are transferred from overseas if they do not comply with the UK law or regulation.
  • The meetings of the Board of Directors must be held in the UK.
  • Operational day-to-day decisions must be made in the UK and the office must be based in the same state.
  • A company may have a non-resident director on the Board of Directors of a UK company if the entire organization is completely based in the UK.
  • The CEO must be a resident and reside in the UK, and, as practice shows, the Compliance Manager as well.
  • The person responsible for a money-laundering control (that can also be a CEO if he has appropriate qualification) must be a resident of the UK.
  • If anyone moves to the UK with the intention of being a CEO, he should know the management rules, depending on the business model. Consequently, it may be necessary to appoint a local manager who has the competence to enforce the rules.
  • The services provided by any third party — as well as IT support services — must be provided on the basis of a concluded contract.

Secondly, there will be a necessity to open bank accounts that will allow your company to provide your services. The bank accounts must be under the name of your UK registered company. The accounts will be required to receive the customer's funds, until they are sent to the final recipient.

The accounts can be opened at any bank. Moreover, it should be a savings account. It is an important requirement of the FCA.

The main features that must be considered for submitting an application:

  • A business plan that describes the company activities, the proposed range of services and the corresponding control bodies in details
  • Provide the information about the possibility of an internal local control. It means the operations of the financial crime prevent, as well as observance of a complaint procedure, that will be carefully documented. There must be a Supreme Management Authority to deal with these complaints.
  • Keep the accounting records, including the payments verification to the bank accounts
  • Establish a business continuity and emergency recovery procedures

Calculating the price of an EMI license obtaining

The cost of services of a license obtaining (includes registration of the UK LTD)

35 000 EUR

Authorized capital of a company

350 000 EUR

FCA levies

5 000 GPB

A Resident Director (a year)

70 000 GPB

A Real office (a year)

80 000 GPB

Opening an account

990 GPB

Electronic Money License in Latvia (EMI in Latvia)

This section provides information on the factors of an EMI license obtaining in Latvia — a license for electronic money in Latvia. The license is obtained by filing an application, as well as a number of other documents, to the EFSA — Estonian Financial Supervision Authority
This is the best option in terms of timelines / price / European license status.
Acalista group can offer such jurisdictions as Malta, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Great Britain, but all of them will be more expensive.

More details about the EMI license in Latvia

According to the Latvian legislation, if the amount of the issued e-money in the business plan does not exceed 2 million euros per year, the company can start its activities in Latvia after registration (without obtaining a full license).
In this case, information about the company, members of the board, a plan of commercial activities, documents on a money-laundering control and information on measures for the client money safety are submitted to the Financial and Capital Market Commission. There are no capital requirements.
If you are planning a larger turnover, you need to obtain a large (full) license. In this case, the initial capital of the company applying for a license must be at least 350,000 euros. The information and documents specified in the law should be prepared for a licence obtaining (we can provide more details on your request).

If you are planning to start an e-money company,
we suggest doing it in this order:
  • Make a registration of a company in Latvia.
    In this case, besides the company registration, it is necessary to submit to the Authority a smaller package of documents that:
    • firstly, will simplify the process of the necessary procedure to start an activity;
    • secondly, will allow to detect and settle all possible claims of the commission regarding the board members and the commercial plan (the basis of which will be later used to obtain a license) at the initial stage;
    • thirdly, will allow you to know better the specifics of the company's work in this jurisdiction
  • Please note that registered companies must operate only in the territory of Latvia. However, in the case of providing services on the Internet, it is difficult to identify the service territory. That is, if an agreement is concluded in Riga, Latvia, it can be insisted that the service is provided in Latvia (a lot of companies, registered in Latvia and working with foreign clients do that).
  • We recommend to go through the first registration stage, regardless whether you are ready for the whole licensing or not, as it allows the FKTK to get acquainted with your company beforehand and will simplify the further licensing procedure.

The price

  • a small license (aka registration) — 15,000 euros, timelines are 3-6 months
  • a full license (with the AC of 350,000 euros ) — 28,000 euros, timelines are 6-10 months

Both the small and full licenses are protected by PSD.

EMI license in the Czech Republic

There are 2 types of licenses for electronic money institutions: EMI – an electronic money institution and SEMI – small electronic money issuer in the Czech Republic.

The specialists of the Acalista group have extensive experience in the preparation and execution of the required documents for obtaining EMI and SEMI licenses in the Czech Republic. Also, we maintain partnerships with the Czech National Bank — the institution that gives the licenses and controls the EMI in the Czech Republic.

You can find the basic information about the EMI and SEMI licenses, processing times, fees and charges below.

SEMI — Small electronic money issuer

Small electronic money issuer License: a processing time — approximately 1-2 months.

For a SEMI license obtaining, the following documents must be submitted to the Czech National Bank (all documents, except the integrity certificates, will be prepared by specialists of our company based on the information received from you):
  • An application for the company entering into the SEMI register;
  • A business license (an extract from the commercial register);
  • An integrity certificate issued by a foreign government for each chief officer;
  • A questionnaire regarding the assessment of each chief SEMI officer.
  • A business plan (a real business plan for the first 12 months of the SEMI activities, including the full financial statements, with detailed business plan comments, taking into account the average monthly limit of EUR 5,000,000 of issued electronic money);
  • A description of the way of individual payment services;
  • A chosen method of protecting the principals funds.

EMI — electronic money institution

Electronic money institution (EMI) license: a processing time — about 6 months.

The price of a license obtaining ranges from EUR 65,000 to EUR 90,000 plus VAT. The duty to the Czech National Bank is approximately 2000 Euro.

Our services price depends on the number of required services — the rate of 90,000 EUR includes a full package of services:

  • A business plan preparation;
  • Financial calculations for the license;
  • Coordination of documents with the National Bank of the Czech Republic;
  • Preparation of the internal documents;
  • Integration of the AML and KYC procedures for obtaining a license.

The specialists of the Acalista group will provide you with expert advice on a license obtaining in the suitable jurisdiction.

For an EMI license obtaining, the following documents must be submitted to the Czech National Bank (all documents, except the integrity certificates, will be prepared by specialists of our company based on the information received from you):
  • An application for the implementation of the EMI activities;
  • A business license (an extract from the commercial register);
  • A document on the source of the initial capital and any other financial resources for the amount of the paid up authorized capital;
  • Financial reports;
  • An integrity certificate issued by a foreign government for each chief officer;
  • A questionnaire regarding the assessment of each chief EMI officer, details of the professional experience and education of each senior authorized person, who actually runs the activities related to the electronic money establishment and providing the payment services.
  • A business plan (a real business plan for the first 12 months of the SEMI activities, including the full financial statements, with detailed business plan comments);
  • Description of the management system (an organizational structure, a control system of the risk for obligations related to countering the AML);
  • A chosen method of protecting the principals funds.
  • Description of the methods for electronic money issuing and carrying out individual payment transactions;
  • Description of the staff structure, organizational and technical measures for individual needs, indicating the estimated number of employees in the relevant structural units. Specification of the information system, accounting and financial reporting systems, and also, if the applicant intends to use agents, explanation of their activities and control;
  • Specification of the subjects, scope and methods of additional activities;
  • The proposed approach for applying to the EMI in the case of the capital sufficiency calculating, including the justification for the proposed approach, a data on the calculation of the capital sufficiency, as well as calculations of capital sufficiency in accordance with all the EMI structuring approaches;
  • The initial capital must be at least 350,000 euros;
  • The details of legal entities that are holding shares in the EMI (10 or more percent of shares or voting rights) or legal entities closely related to the EMI (legal entities with 20% in share capital or mutual voting rights, as well as persons managing or being controlled by the same leading person).

Gaming license in Curacao

Curacao is a jurisdiction in the southern Caribbean off the coast of Venezuela. It is a part of federation within the Netherlands.

The area is 444 kilometers.

Population is 158 986 people.

The Licenses in Curacao have become popular since 1996, this jurisdiction was one of the first in the world to start the issuance of such licenses.

Online gaming is a legal activity in Curacao if an electronic gaming company is licensed (sublicensed) properly. Online Gaming legislation was created in 1993 when the islands were under the jurisdiction of the Netherlands Antilles.

General requirements for a license
obtaining

In order to obtain a license, you must provide the following documents:

  • The original certificate of no criminal record of the company owners, not over than 3 months old;
  • Notarized /certified copy(s) of passport(s);
  • The original of a recommendation letter from the bank for owners, not over than 3 months old;
  • Original or notarized / certified copies of the utility bills not over than 3 months old;
  • Description of the offered games;
  • Confirmation of the RNG application and its certification by a third party;
  • A Geographic/target market;
  • The owners' confirmation that they have blocked the access to services for the juvenile and provided information about problems with gambling and addiction on the site;
  • A hosting with minimum requirements for the customer database back up and transactions in Curacao;

Our turnkey service package for E-Gaming business operators with subLicense in Curacao includes everything you need
to get started.

What does the service package include?

Our service package includes everything you need to install and operate an online electronic gaming company with a subLicense in Curacao.

In more details:

Registration of an offshore holding company;

Registration of an operating company in the EU;

Curacao E-Gaming subLicense Obtaining;

European Trading Company, particularly,
can be used for:
  • Providing services for any online gambling around the world, except the several jurisdictions in target markets such as the USA, Curacao, Cyprus and some others.
  • Contracting with suppliers of merchant accounts, software providers, etc. We can also help you with it.
  • Opening the bank accounts anywhere in the world where the e-gaming activity is accepted.
  • Ownership of intellectual property rights such as domain names, URLs, etc.
  • Carrying out the promotional activities for your business and the business of other operators (in countries with VAT – to reduce VAT).

Gaming license in Malta

Over the past years Malta has become a leading and well-regulated European gaming jurisdiction, that accepts approximately 10% of the world's online gaming companies. The Government of Malta has carried out a complete review and consolidation of the gaming legislation, that has created the Malta Gaming Authority (MGA).

The processing time of an application for the iGaming license in the Maltese authorities takes on average 4 to 6 months. The procedure timelines depend just on the time it takes for the applicant to provide the necessary documentation and feedback.

General requirements for a license
obtaining

  • A Minimum share capital – $ 40,000 (can be formed after the MGA accepts a license issuing);
  • An Information about the officals: Anti-Money Laundering Officer; An Information security officer – should be freely available;
  • Segregated operating and gaming funds (a player account and company operating account independently);
  • A Regulatory data is becoming available to the authorities.

The Procedure

Applicants are required to complete the KYC and Due Diligence processes with the Malta Gaming Authority (“MGA”) before submitting an application. It is made in order to ensure that the applicant complies with the legal requirements of Malta, the license application is correctly developed and that all the essential elements are present and meet the procedure.

It usually helps to speed up the licensing process, since there would not be a missing or incomplete information that could slow down the whole procedure.

Application process

At this stage, the MGA checks:

  • Suitability of the applicant for gambling activity
    The MGA conducts due diligence analyze of all information about officials involved in the financing and management of the applicant's company. The authority also carries out the investigation on the company's integrity with other national and international regulatory and law enforcement agencies.
  • The company's business plan correctness.
    The MGA conducts a thorough financial analysis of the applicant's business plan. The business plan is expected to include a detailed course of action, as well as details related to marketing strategies, workforce planning and growth rates.
  • if a company meets the operational and statutory requirements to fulfill the legal obligations expected by the Maltese Legislation;
    The applicant is verifying for the technical background necessary for running a business. This process includes an analysis of the company founding documents, games, business processes related to conducting the remote games, rules, conditions and procedures for games, application and system architecture of gaming and control systems.
    The above components represent an audit of the application requirements and should be completed in 12-16 weeks.
  • If the candidate correctly implemented what had he used in the technical terms before the application was released.
    After all the steps have been successfully completed, the MGA will inform the candidate that the application has been confirmed and will invite the applicant to implement the technical environment for starting the activities.
    The applicant has 60 days to complete this operation. If the applicant does not finish the operation during this time, the application will be considered as a suspended and must be resubmitted.
    During these 60 days, the applicant may request an external systems audit (performed by an independent third party contracted with the MGA) at a fixed market price.
    The MGA allows minimal divergence from the application at this stage, but any significant changes to the gaming system will require re-submition of a new application.
    After the certification process has been successfully completed, the MGA issues a license for a period of five (5) years.
  • Verification of conformity
    Once the license is issued, an independent third party will contract with the MGA (at a fixed market price) to perform a series of compliance inspection on the licensees' operations.

Gaming license in Cyprus

A Gaming license in Cyprus. Cyprus is still a global trading center, where the control and regulation of Forex is carried out by the legislation. The Cyprus legislation provides the non-resident taxpayers with a 0% dividend tax.

The current Betting Law 2012 – Law 106 (1) / 2012 specifies the legal basis for the activities of betting operators and bookmakers. The National Bookmaker Authority (NBA) monitors the bookmakers activities in Cyprus – the online betting by gaming operators.

There are licenses of the following types:

class A – it regulates the bets on sports games. Bookmakers companies have a license of this class. All bets can be taken except for the horse racing. It doesn't work in the cyber world.

class B – it regulates the online activities of bookmakers. Bookmakers take the virtual reality sports betting. The exception is the slot machines, lotteries, online casinos.

Conditions for a license applying

The application procedure for a Class A or Class B license has a number of requirements.

  • The applicant is required to own the shares, registered in Cyprus.
  • It is necessary to have a company on the island whose main activity is betting. If the company is registered abroad, it is possible to create a branch of the foreign company in Cyprus or enter into a partnership with a Cyprus company.
    However, in this case, the applicant must have a share capital of at least EUR 500,000. The minimum capital requirement can be applied to both the Cypriot companies and foreign ones.
  • The guarantee term for deposits in a bank in Cyprus or any other state (the EU membership is compulsory) in the amount of EUR 550,000 is valid for six months after obtaining a license.
  • A high solvency for payments to players.
  • The organization must have a system for the bets recording.
  • It should protect players under the rules, according to the Betting Law, 2012.

Regardless of the class, all licenses are issued for a period of one or two years. In some cases, the period may be extended. In case of the rules violation, the NBA may revoke the license or suspend it under the Betting Law, 2012.

Additionally, the licensee must pay a fee of EUR 30,000 for one year and EUR 45,000 for two years.

Requirements for licensees

Applicants for a license are subject to additional requirements:

the payments for those who have received a class B license are made through a credit/debit card or through other types of electronic transfers (art. 54, the Betting Law, 2012);

During the Class B licensee are taking the electronic bets, he cannot make any transactions with cash (Art. 58 (1), the Betting Law, 2012);

The class B licensees are prohibited to take the bets if the funds on the company's account are insufficient to cover the player's bet;

The licensees of Class B are required to have a valid bank account that operates in Cyprus.

Tax
amount

The tax on the combined rate is calculated at 13%: a net profit – 10%, 3% – other taxes. 2% of the indicated 3% are allocated for the sports federations development and 1% – for the improvement of gambling programs (Article 71 of the Betting Law, 2012).

Software
requirements

The main backup server, that is located on the island, must be connected to the authority's computer equipment. Futhermore, the licensee company must have a special website address. The common platform for bets operations must meet the general criteria of the Betting Law, 2012.

Algorithm
of the licensing process

In order to obtain a class A, B license, you must:

register a company in Cyprus;
open a bank account;
fill out a license application;
draw up and submit a declaration on income and property;
prepare and submit the bank guarantees;
make a business plan for the neccessary business area.

Licenses

START TODAY
Лицензия онлайн букмекера на Кипре

В нынешнем году в юридическом области игорной веб-индустрии на европейском континенте протекают серьезные изменения. Одна из основополагающих тенденций на сегодняшний день – это введение, практически, каждым из наиболее значимых государств Европы лицензирования.

Большой спрос к этой сфере услуг дала постоянно увеличивающаяся популярность веббукмекеров и казино, которые основываются в Европейских и оффшорных юрисдикциях, в том числе в юрисдикциях Гибралтара, Мальты, Кюрасао, Коста-Рики.

Рейтинг Букмекеров

«Пальма первенства» в ограничении персональных торговых площадок, безусловно, принадлежит крупнейшим странам Европы, а именно Испании, Италии, Франции, Великобритании.

Эти страны, начиная с 2000-х годов, стали организовывать финансовые учреждения, которые регулируют игорную активность в сети и блокируют вход на торговые площадки для оффшоровых операторов.

Благодаря нишевой позиции игровой веб-индустрии, Европа перестала пытаться ее контролировать на национальном уровне. Вот почему в разработке персональной законодательной базы теперь имеются еще и аутсайдеры. Например, нидерландское государство только в июле 2016 года смогло сформировать нужный законопроект.

И он вряд ли будет в силе с 2018 года. Кипр – это еще одна страна, которая поздно присоединилась к данной тенденции. Это островная красивая страна, которая приняла закон про регулирование игровой деятельности почти десять лет назад – в 2012 году.

Но полноценно регулировать деятельность букмекерских компаний в сети Кипр, в силу многочисленных факторов, стал пробовать только с 2016 года.

Для этих задач была специально создана такая организация, как Нацкомиссия по играм (National Betting Authority). Последняя сказала, что принимает решения выдавать лицензии веб-букмекерам, начиная с третьего октября 2016 года.

Многие туристы из стран Содружества независимых государств, которые приезжали отдохнуть на Кипр, не понаслышке знают, что среди киприотов крайне популярны всевозможные игры.

Почти на каждой магистральной улочке крупного городка здесь будет хотя бы парочка игорных организаций – помещения для игры в кено или бинго, пункты приема ставок букмекерских контор.

Еще совсем недавно на Юге Кипра, где власти более ответственно и серьезно контролируют игорный бизнес, действовал законопроект, который запрещал играть в казино.

Поклонникам таких развлечений приходилось переходить разделительную полосу и ехать в северную часть страны, чтобы попасть в один из центров казино (здесь игорный бизнес под контролем администрации Турции). Но этот запрет не так давно был снят – чтобы привлечь вкладчиков для построения интегрированного курорта по казино.

Кипра интересуют финансово стабильные претенденты на лицензирование

Ясное дело, что крайне высокая популярность игорного бизнеса – это один из основополагающих моментов, из-за которых законодатели поставили крайне высокую планку вхождения на торговые площадки.

Поскольку обязанность и условие сформировать уставной капитал в размере пятисот тысяч евро, с подкреплением гарантией от банковских учреждений тоже на пятьсот тысяч евро, это совсем немало не только по объемам государства с населением меньше одного миллиона человек.

Это в пять-семь раз больше, чем на Мальте и в Великобритании – в лидирующих юрисдикциях.

Лицензированные платежные обязательства

Лицензированные платежные обязательства в тридцать тысяч евро за год за годовое лицензирование и сорок пять тысяч евро за двухгодовое лицензирование – не будет считаться низким. Прибавьте к этому еще и игорное налогообложение в тринадцать процентов от валовой игорной доходности.

Десять процентов от налоговой ставки, непосредственно, будет отправлено в казну. Остаток в три процента будет разделен между фондами, которые поддерживают спортфедерации и фонды, которые предотвращают и лечат игорную зависимость.

Регулятор, который поставил такие немалые условия, дает очень точный сигнал того, что Кипр интересуется исключительно финансово стабильными претендентами на лицензирование.

В число подобных претендентов, логично, что попадают и большие региональные операторы наземного букмекерства. Кроме того, выше обозначенные условия не составляют проблемы для глобальных лидерующих представителей в интернет-области.

Так получится ли у Кипра привлекать лидирующих операторов и лицензирование в государства, повторив прошлый удачный опыт в региональном объеме Мальты, другого средиземноморского активно развивающегося островновго государства?

Наша компания придерживается осторожного мнения на этот счет и имеет в этом плане оптимистические позиции.

С одной стороны, кроме большой цены, лицензирование еще ограничивается по линейке продукции. Создатели законодательных актов предпочитают «убрать» не только игровую линейку казино, но еще и такие типы спотставок, как спортставки на собачьи и лошадиные забеги, спрэд-бэттинг.

Кроме того, регуляторы выдвигают требование применять веб-ресурс конкретно с доменом — .com.cy

Но, кроме таких существенных недочетов, в противовес, можно назвать и суперважные благоприятствующие элементы. Согласно приходящего информационного потока, комиссия обладает широкими источниками для стремительного рассматрения четко выполненных заявок от профессиональных фирм.

Наиболее положительное оценивание – от пары недель до выдачи предварительного одобрения, что намного быстрее других юридических фирм.

Кроме того, НКБ не выдвигает требования о создании полноценной инфраструктуры серверов операторов на кипрском полуострове. На самом деле, хватит всего лишь и одного сервера, чтобы контролировать регуляторскую деятельность.

Но, возможно, самое основное достоинство, в этом случае, – это лингвистическая и геополитическая характеристика и особенность Кипра. В Республике Кипр законодательством признается три языка – греческий, турецкий и английский.

То есть, местное островное лицензирование – это, возможно, наиболее мудрое решение при избрании операторов, которые ориентируются на рынке близлежащих государств с соответствующими языками. С точки зрения репутации, кипрский остров обладает узнаваемыми характеристиками для аудиторий части восточной стороны Средиземного моря.

Кроме того, появление в странах Европы официально прошедших лицензии турецкоязычных веб-сайтов – это, возможно, еще один привлекательный момент для поклонников азартных игр из масштабной диаспоры Турции в странах западной Европы.

Безусловно, Кипр и не сможет обеспечивать сотнями лицензирование, как сейчас это делает Мальта.

Но, вероятно, изначально таких планов и не было. Наверное, основная задача запуска – это привлекать несколько сотен стабильных и профессиональных операторов для финансово счастливого запуска в регионе и в самом государстве.

General requirements for a license
obtaining

The supervisory authority GSC set on the requirements for a license registration:

  • a registration should be carried out only in the Isle of Man;
  • a founding memberships appoint two directors;
  • managers must be the residents of the Island;
  • opening of bank accounts in the island is compulsory.

For registering an application, the candidate pays the prescribed state fee during the consideration period. More about taxation:

  • an income tax is – 1.5%, provided that the gross income is not more than twenty thousand pounds sterling per year;
  • a turnover tax – 0.5%, if the annual profit is up to forty thousand pounds per year;
  • an income tax for over than forty thousand pounds sterling per year – 0.1%;
  • for bookmakers and sweepstakes – 15% of the profits.

Great Britain expects the owner of the enterprise to actually conduct business on the territory of the Isle of Man. The supervisory authority pays special attention to this factor, conducting inspections for providing the accurate data regularly.

A package of documents for registration

There are certain requirements for registration of licenses. Particularly, in the Isle of Man, you must provide:

copies of identity documents (passport) of the shareholders memberships;

a copy of the Articles of Association, taking into account the decision of the founding meeting on the assignment of a status, name to a company;

bank statements and other documents confirming the opening of an account, certified by a notary;

a business plan with graphs of income, investments, development paths;

providing the receipts for the state fees payment.

More information about the commission requirements you can find on the official GSC website.

Possibilities, provided
by a license

As was mentioned above, the Isle of Man has a regulatory body (the GSC) that issues a license and legalizes:

  • standard gambling organizations, halls, attractions;
  • online casinos, lotteries, virtual games, sports and other tournaments;
  • betting organizations activities (bookmakers, sweepstakes);
  • stock-exchange and financial rates.

An applicant must provide a well-developed business plan, that will indicate the estimated money turnover, the way of operator financing. This is required to ensure the commission that the applicant will not go broke and users' finances are not in danger.

The gambling license, issued by the Austrian government, is one of the most prestigious. This is proved by these facts:

  • it is the European Union state;
  • the country's government is loyal to gambling (supports gambling at all stages of its operation);

It should be noted that it has become more difficult to get a license since 2010, as the requirements have become more strict:

  • a gambling company must be located not closer than fifteen kilometers from the capital of the state – Vienna;
  • the land-based gambling houses are considered to be the main business, and online casinos are a secondary business.

However, according to the new legislation, gambling sites can be registered in all regions of Austria (previously only four regions were available). Moreover, a lot of players trust the Austrian license, that increases the number of customers at a gambling house with such a permition.

Gambling license in Austria:
requirements and terms

  • a compulsory registration in the territory of Austria;
  • only Austrians should be the clients of gambling plarforms.

Notably, that gambling houses with licenses from other jurisdictions can operate in Austria, but they have less possibilities (for example, they are prohibited from advertising their services in the country). Another exception is a closed access to information about the registration process.

You can contact the existing gambling houses in Austria or submit a request to the licensing commission to get the necessary information.

For obtaining a license, the commission that controls gambling activities is provided with:

  • the confirming documents of a company registration in the country (The Minutes of the Constituent Assembly, The Lease of an Office Space Agreement, the Articles of Association, an information about the directors, etc.);
  • a bank statement of an open account (to prove the solvency);
  • a detailed business plan (at least for three months);
  • positive results of an inspection and testing of the software and equipment;
  • a list of all games (a name, a description, a principle of operation) and all payment systems used by the organization.

According to the Federal Ministry of Finance, that regulates the gaming business in Austria, the gambling is widely represented in casinos (e.g. slots, roulettes, blackjack, dice, poker, bets, etc.).

The Gaming Commission controls this type of activity, deals with cases of an illegal gambling. It makes a license procedure easier as only one authority resolve all issues.

Required documentation

The Commission will not issue a license without the following documents:

  • the identity documents of all founders;
  • the tax records for the last three periods (copies are enough);
  • the court statement about the absence of a criminal record, not over than 3 months old;
  • an Act on the political and civil rights.

The annual fee is 250 thousand euros per year, the casino is taxed at 11% rate. The process takes up to two months. The main casino license is issued for up to 15 years.

Gaming license principles

In 1999, the Belgian government passed a law to legalize organization and running of gambling. The jurisdiction allows to visit the gambling organizations and play the casinos only from the age of 21. Registration of the online casino visitors is required with the passport information or an identification number indicating.

If the casino breaks the law, it can lead to the criminal case opening or the fine imposition of up to 100 thousand euros. If a player from blacklisted states plays on the site, he can pay a fine of up to 25 thousand euros.

The Government officials are prohibited to be engaged in the gambling business. The license must be renewed upon its termination, or there is an automatic exclusion from the list of persons, entitled to conduct a gambling business. It is prohibited to promote any gambling entertainment on TV until 8 p.m.

Permission issued for gambling activities

An official site indicates a classification of the licenses, the "+" means an online casino license. The main types of a gambling legalization:

  • G1 – G2 for broadcasting the gambling games on TV and phone;
  • F1 – F2 – F + must be on racetracks where the horse races are held and there are sweepstakes, F + legalizes online sweepstakes;
  • E is owned by the software creators for the gambling halls;
  • D is required for the service staff in gambling houses;
  • C is needed for the bars with slot machines;
  • B – B + a license for casinos, where the slot machines are located; it can be obtained by the casinos that have already had a license;
  • A – A + is required for all real casinos in the country.

A permission for online casinos is not given separately, only as an annex to the main one. The number of allowed online licenses for the A + casino is nine licenses, 180 for the B+, 34 licenses for the F+.

The law provides the special licensing rules for the following categories:

  • conduction a lottery;
  • production of a gaming software;
  • equipment of the playing machines and tables;
  • the racetrack bets;
  • the water sports betting;
  • a bookmaker activity;
  • a bingo;
  • a casino;
  • slot machines.

For three decades, the Romanian government has been issuing and amending the bills regulating the gambling business. Later, a license for running a gambling business in Romania and all the operation principles of these enterprises were formed.

The gambling industry is one of the largest in the state. Nowadays there are two bodies that control gaming activities in Romania:

  • the Ministry of Finance (controls the income of gaming organizations);
  • the Gambling Commission under the Ministry (issues certificates and licenses to legitimate a gambling business).

Members of this commission are prohibited from opening their own casinos in any jurisdiction.

According to Romanian legislation, it is possible to implement
the following gambling (both physical and virtual):

  • slot machines;
  • bingo;
  • betting;
  • internet rooms;
  • lotteries;
  • Black Jack;
  • rates;
  • sweepstakes;
  • poker;
  • roulette.

A necessary condition to establish and conduct gambling activities is licensing, as well as obtaining the official permission for the gambling areas activities.

Violations in conducting a gambling business in Romania

It is an offense to work without license or use an expired one. In this case, the owner will have to pay an administrative fine, the amount of that varies from five hundred thousand to ten million lei and depends on the type of gambling.

The Romanian government has established quite strict rules, prescribing the basic requirements for registering and conducting gambling activities.

All licenses for gambling business are valid from one to five years (depending on the game) and require the follow-up review and renewal of certificates upon the expiration. If a license is recieved, it is necessary to place it on the website (for online games) or in a visible to visitors place (for land-based physical business).

Romania and the license
for the slot machines

In order to register and conduct gaming activities related to the slot machines, it is necessary to obtain documents for each type of machine, that indicate the inspections of machines for operability and the absence of breakdowns (for the online casino, the update of the certificate of the Random Number Generator is checked by an audit).

It is not difficult to obtain such a license in Romania, provided that:

  • the owner of the casino has reached the age of 23, is not a civil servant, has no criminal record;
  • the slot machines are installed far from the monuments, educational and medical institutions, cultural objects;
  • the game rooms are equipped with the separate entrances (especially important if they are located in the same building with shops and cafes).

The legal validity of the license for slot machines lasts three years and is renewed automatically after verification by the commission.

Lottery in Romania: An Operating license

The lotteries are quite popular in Romania. In order to obtain a legitimate permission to carry out the lottery draws in the state, it is necessary to submit a full package of documents to the Gambling Commission.

The main documentation:

  • an agreement on the lease or purchase the premises where the activity will be carried out;
  • an application in Romanian with the signature (an original) of the counterparty;
  • the Certificate of the absence of a criminal records;
  • the necessary documents for the software and equipment using in the game;
  • the documents indicating the client's sources of investment.

Moreover, the experts from the commission constantly check the level of payments.

Start a casino: basic requirements

There are special requirements for opening a casino in the state, such as:

  • ten gaming tables (four of them are for the roulette);
  • a separate entrance;
  • a full compliance with operational standards (including a toilet and a breackroom for employees);
  • a compulsory inspection of the office for compliance with the safety measures (fire regulations) and sanitary standards of activity.
Bookmakers in Romania

It is necessary to study the rules for obtaining a betting license carefully in order to avoid violations of the gambling business legislation. The main requirements are:

  • the functional electronics with relevant documents;
  • the presence of video cameras in the game room, as well as in the cashier's room;
  • a video surveillance with the color recording (for resolving the controversial issues);
  • keeping the video records for up to ten years or more;
  • the employees and owners of bookmakers are not allowed to take part in disputes, bets, gambling.
Regulations for a bingo license obtaining in Romania

The main condition for a license obtaining is the location of the office. It should be at least thirty meters away from parks, shops, recreation areas, a residential complex, etc.

A Romanian bingo license allows you to accept bets in foreign currency. But it requires additional permission from a banking institution in Romania.

START TODAY
Gaming license in El Salvador

El Salvador is a country on the Pacific coast of Central America, that has a profitable financial indicator; a gambling licensing is carried out regularly in El Salvador.

The development strategy is based on a policy of openness to international trade and investment, therefore the state is directly related to the foreign investment.

Licensed services

Timelines: within seven weeks.
Minimum initial capital: US $ 2,000. Companies with such capital are subject to a registration tax of US $ 11.40.

Overview

The most common legal entity in El Salvador is a Limited Liability Company (LLC).

It is important to note that the corporate income tax rate in El Salvador is 30% and is levied on the total income of a company.

However, a corporate income tax is based on a territorial principle and applies to the goods located in El Salvador, types of activities and capital investments, as well as any services provided in the country.

Although there are no restrictions on the citizenship or place of a shareholder residence, it is important to take into account that a special withholding tax rate of 25% applies for paying dividends, interest and royalties to a resident.

Required documents

In order to obtain a permit for a gambling business in El Salvador, you must provide the following documents:

  • a notarized copy of a valid passport (of each director or shareholder);
  • a notarized copy of the document confirming the residential address (for example, the utility bill for each director);
  • the Tax Identification Number (NIT) – for each shareholder (if any);
  • a bank statement (of each director);
  • two letters of recommendation from attorneys (for each director or shareholder);
  • a detailed resume with the date and signature of the applicant (for each director or shareholder);
  • the Diploma of Higher Education;
  • a certificate of the absence of a criminal record.

If the shareholder is a legal entity (company), it is necessary to submit:

  • a certified copy of the certificate of a company incorporation;
  • a list of shareholders;
  • a copy of the latest annual / financial report;
  • an Apostilled Certificate of Reliability (a Certificate of Good Standing).

As an additional precaution, the government authorities may require the originals of documents confirming the source of income.

Additional documents can be requested by the secretariat or local bank at any time to verify and confirm a specific information.

All documentation is provided in English. If the documents are not in English, they must be accompanied by a notarized translation.

Benefits:

Small amount of an initial capital.

Online gambling is not regulated in El Salvador.

The jurisdiction is not blacklisted.

How to start a gambling business in El Salvador

Requirements:

  • At least 1 director (a natural person, no restrictions on citizenship or place of residence).
  • At least 2 Shareholders (natural or legal person, no restrictions on citizenship or place of residence).

Taxation:

  • an income tax – 30%;
  • a tax "Pago a Cuenta" – 1.75% (is paid monthly as an advance payment of a corporate income tax);
  • a value added tax (VAT) – 13%;
  • a non-resident income tax:
  • Non-resident: 5% on dividends, 20% on interest, 20% on royalties.
  • Non-resident with no tax benefits: 25% on dividends, 25% on interest, 25% on royalties.

Accounting and auditing requirements

  • The company is obliged to conduct an external audit.
  • An annual financial statements to the Chamber of Commerce.
  • An annual tax audit depends on the company's income.
  • A local office is required.
  • A registered representative is required. The company must appoint a local administrator who will represent its interests in the tax office of El Salvador, it can be a resident or a foreigner residing in El Salvador.
  • A secretary is required.

Company name

  • The letters – the Latin alphabet.
  • It must contain the words "Limited Liability Company" or the abbreviation "LLC".
  • Do not use the names of the state authorities and local self-government bodies in the name.
  • The name of the company should not go against the moral norms, and also should not be misleading regarding the organizational and legal form, area of activity.
  • Do not use the names of existing companies or identical to them.
  • The Registrar can reject any name that is considered as inappropriate or contrary to the public interest.
The Procedure

In order to obtain a permission for online gamble business in El Salvador, the applicant should:

  • make a request for a company name reservation;
  • apply to the Ministry of Finance for obtaining the Tax Identification Number (NIT) and The Value Added Tax Identification Number (IVA);
  • make a registration at the city hall;
  • make a registration in the Main Department of Statistics and Population Census;
  • make a registration in the Chamber of Commerce;
  • open a bank account.

Gambling and online casinos in Estonia – Gaming license in Estonia

for conducting gambling operations for a period of ten years.

Today, there are eight licensed operators on the online gambling market in Estonia and over 800 online casinos are blacklisted in the country.

All owners of casinos and gambling sites that want to operate on Estonian territory, must get a gambling license. This rule applies to all organizations, whether they are located in the European Union or not.

At the same time, there are a number of requirements to the applicant:

  • a documentary confirmation of a share capital of at least EUR 1 million;
  • a certificate of no criminal record and violations in the gaming business;
  • a compliance with the Estonian laws;
  • an obligation that the license will not be passed to the third party;
  • guarantees of running a gambling business only;
  • payment of a license fee of 47,934 euros.
Online casino license price

  • A License fee for the process coordination – 31 956 €.
  • An extra fee for a sweepstake creating – 3 196 € (if it is necessary).
Taxes
  • a casino – 5% of an income;
  • a lottery – 18% of an income;
  • the slot machines – depends on their number and the presented gaming platform.
Requirements
  • if the casinos operates on the sea transport, including foreign ones, under the Estonian flag, they must also have a license;
  • the games' names – with the prefix of the manufacturer;
  • there should be a tab with the information about the game rules and administrator contacts on each site.

START TODAY
Gaming license in Denmark

Despite the fact that by the European standards, Denmark is a fairly small country (a total area is 43 thousand km2 , population is about 6 million), it shows excellent results in economic and social development, that is prooved by the 4th place in the world, according to the human development index.

It includes a high standard of living (the average salary is 30% higher than the EU average), as well as there is a wide range of activities out the working hours. It is possible because of the 37.5 hour workweek.

Denmark is one of the happiest countries in the world according to the special research conducted in 2016. In 2015, an organization of the economic development also said that Denmark has the least gap between the two extremes of human well-being.

Despite the general liberalization of Danish legislation, the position of the gambling business is rather doubtful, since the registration of a gambling business in Denmark has a controversial origin. But, as you know, the general liberal program does not include direct regulation of the service market by the relevant government agencies.

Therefore, the issue of a gambling business organization in Denmark requires a detailed analysis.

History of a gambling business legalization in Denmark

The history of illegal gambling in Denmark is quite long. In the post-war period, it was easier to monopolize all possible types of gambling than to fight them. In 1948, the Danske Spil company was created for this. This brand has existed to that end.

Though, the slot machines was allowed in the entertainment places, the game was provided only for the conditional monetary units.

Later, at the turn of the 70s and 80s of the twentieth century, there was a large number of clandestine gambling organizations, that were available only for trusted people. Such places were usually located in bars.

An interesting fact is that in the clandestine gambling places the game was for matches or pieces of paper, that were later exchanged for cash, according to the specially established pay tables.

After the legislation had taken another step towards liberalizing gambling in 1990, the demand for clandestine organizations was redused.

The amendments to the current legislation provided opportunities for the admission of the casino operators from a number of European countries (Germany, Austria, the Netherlands). However, the activities in Denmark need obtaining a license and compliance with the extremely strict requirements.

One of the regulations that the requirements included, was the creation a joint venture with a resident from Denmark by a foreign agent. Due to this fact, the gambling organizations have started to placed in the hotels, that operate as partners.

With the Internet development, a large number of online casinos have appeared with the full tools in the form of games and bets. As this business sector began to grow rapidly, the government faced the need for legislative regulation of it.

One of the first steps was the ban on the foreign companies activities in territories controlled by the Danish jurisdiction in 2003. Online casino operators were quite often registered in countries with a freer market in terms of government control.

Therefore, the Danish banks were forced to refuse servicing the credit cards, that were used to pay for services in the online gambling organizations.

When such initiatives were appeared in Danish legislation, it has caused a negative reaction from the European Union. The disagreement between local requirements and European institutions has been worsened since Denmark ratified the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union in 2008.

For the status quo resumption, there were made changes in the existing legislation on the gambling business in 2010. The applying started in 2012.

One of the initiatives was the Danske Spil's legal deprivation of gambling monopolization and de facto the access of the foreign agents to the local market. The state retained the right for the state lottery, bingo game, lottery scratch cards, bets on horse, dog and pigeon races.

The private companies have got the right to engage in such gambling activities as slots, betting and online casinos.

However, in 2014, a number of amendments were adopted. It has significantly tightened the legislation against the foreign operators. First of all, both operators and distributors of casino software, according to the new amendments, were obliged to be tested and licensed in Denmark.

The online casinos owners from abroad were obliged to pay tax in the amount of 20% of income to the Danish budget.

Types of gambling that are subject to be licensed

According to the information of 2013, the most popular and profitable types of gambling activity are:

lotteries – $ 457 million;

slot machines – $ 240 million;

betting – $ 205 million;

online casino – $ 146 million;

regular casinos – $ 49.4 million;

horse racing – $ 19.9 million.

The total amount of income from the types of gambling business, regulated by the state law, is $ 1.12 billion as of 2013.

Among other types of gaming activities is a poker. According to the Danish legislation, the sports poker cannot be classified as gambling, and thereby, the organization does not need a license.

The poker, especially an online game, has been popular in Denmark for quite a long time. This popularity is caused by the success of Copenhagen resident Gustav Hansen, a professional poker player. The amount of a prize money he had gotten for over 10 years of playing was almost $ 10 million.

The popularity of poker in Denmark is also a reason why this small country is consistently ranked 25th in the global WSOP rankings. Unfortunately, the information on an annual income for a poker organization is unclear.

Legal aspects
of running a gambling business in Denmark

A commercial gaming activities will not be legal without obtaining an official permit from the appropriate authority. The Ministry of Justice provides the licensing of gambling organizarions.

The concept of gambling debt is equated to a “duty of honor” in public etiquette, because the legal payment of gambling debts is not provided for the unlicensed games.

According to the legislative regulations, a specialized Office of Gambling Control has been providing licenses for individuals and legal entities who want to conduct commercial gambling activities since 2012. The licensing terms are following:

  • providing a detailed justification for conducting the commercial activities in this area from the benefit aspect;
  • the applicant has no criminal record and has reached the age of 21;
  • confirmation of the clear business reputation of the company;
  • payment of the duty, that is $ 37,000 for online casinos and bookmakers, and the duty for both types of commercial organizations will be $ 52,000, it can be paid in local currency;
  • the duty for the license itself can vary from $ 7,400 to $ 220,000.

Criminal liability for the gaming activities organizing in a public place can be in the form of a fine or one year in prison.

Criminal liability for providing premises for the unlicensed gambling is in a form of a fine or imprisonment for up to six months, and direct participation in gambling is punished by fines.

Organization of lotteries

Initially, the Danske Spil organization, when it was founded in 1948, was called Dansk Tipstjeneste. The organization was founded by the Danish government, the Olympic Committee and the Sports Federation. About 80% of the sponsorship amount was provided by the government.

Two companies were created in 2012, based on this organization. The first one, The Danske Lotteri Spil, covers the lottery segment (Lotto, Keno, Eurojackpot), Bingo lotto, accepts bets on Dantoto equestrian sports and organizes Quick scratch cards. The second, the Danske Licens Spil, is engaged in the activities of bookmakers and online gambling.

There is also another state lottery called Klasseloteriet. Before the active development of the Internet, tickets were distributed through a certified dealer network. The slogan, that has been constant for many years, says “Denmark's Millions Lottery”..

It performs two functions at once – to emphasize the amount of the potential winnings and the extencive participation in the lottery. Each ticket contains a unique numerical combination, and the price of each lottery ticket directly depends on the potential winnings.

Online casinos

Before the Danish online casino legislation was amended in 2010, there had been about 400 online casinos in the Kingdom, most of which were created in collaboration with the Danish residents.

Due to the fact that the new legislation provided the licensing, a large number of operators decided to legalize their commercial activities. During the first year of the new legislation, only 25 licenses were issued by the Danish Gambling Authority.

The companies such as the 888, the Ladbrokes and the Bwin were among the first to legalize their sites. At the same time, about 57 sites were blacklisted as unlicensed.

There are currently about 210 online casinos in Denmark. Most of them have two languages in the interface – Danish and English, and currencies they use are dollars, euros and Danish kroner. Such sites as Dansk777 Casino, Casino Cruise and Bet365 use the toolkit that matches the casino exactly.

Sites like All Slots Mobile, 32Red Mobile, and Golden Riviera specialize in mobile gambling content. Services such as Zezam, Spillenjørnet, Live Casino and Casino are officially supported by the Danske Licens Spil.

Betting

The bets are mostly accepted on various sports events in the gambling industry. The most popular events are soccer competitions that are broadcasted on the Danish television, i.e. the English Premier League and the National Football League.

Because of the golf success of Thomas Bjorn, a resident of Silkeborg, the sport calls attention by the Danes too and the bets are accepted on it. Also, such sports as handball and badminton are popular with bookmakers. Recently, there has also been an increase in the number of bets on cycling.

In many ways, such a high popularity of this sports competition is caused by Denmark's proposal to host the first stage of the Tour de France on its territory.

A smaller, but no less significant, segment in the betting industry is the financial and political events – an integral part of the betting industry.

The TopBetta, the Fanaments and the Star Fantasy League Operators have a clear focus on the fantasy sports betting, but other operators, such as the Bet365, also have these items in the sportsbook list.

Notably, that the Bet365 and the BetEnt are affiliated representations of world-class bookmakers, but the Danske Licens Spil is the leader among operators.

Land-based casino organization

This type of casino effected to the weakening of the Danske Spil state monopoly. Nowadays, the stationary casinos are operating in Copenhagen, Aalborg, Helsingor, Aarhus, Vejle and Odense.

Moreover, there is the Pearl Seaways ferry that runs between Oslo and Copenhagen, that is also provided by a gambling organization. The Copenhagen casino are the first among the largest gambling organizations in Northern Europe. The types of gambling in land-based casinos are represented by slots, poker, blackjack, roulette, baccarat and punto banco.

The regulation of this type of casino is carried out as follows:

  • the minimum entrance fee should be about $ 14;
  • the casino should work no more than 14 hours a day;
  • the clients must have the membership cards;
  • the minors cannot join games;
  • the clients identification.

There is also a list of rules, controlled by the police, about using the recording techniques and the clients' appearance.

Horseback Riding

The horse racing is a well-developed sport in Denmark. There are 9 racetracks, the largest ones are located in Klumpenborg, Bornholm and Billund. The bets are accepted both beforehand or in-play. The official operator of the equestrian sports betting is the state-owned company – the Danske Lotteti Spil.

Slot machine industry

If we look at the data for Denmark in 2012 (that is, even before the amendments to the legislation were adapted) – they are as follows:

  • classic slot machines – 26 thousand;
  • arcade slot machines – 3.3 thousand.

An average annual income from using the slot machines was about $ 266 million in 2012. This index looks quite impressive, compared with an annual income from online games and betting in general. The last one was $ 296 million in the same year.

State influence
on the gambling services market

Despite the fact that the state monopoly on gambling was officially annuled in 2010, many of the control mechanisms and regulatory functions are still running within the state jurisdiction:

  • A licenses obtaining for gambling business. Both private and public companies are required to get a license. Moreover, even the main state operator – the Danske Spil is required to be licensed annually, while the list of games for applicants is strictly regulated.
  • Regulation of the advertising campaigns. The operator is allowed to advertise its products only after obtaining a license, and should not use the services of third parties. It is forbidden to involve celebrities in the advertising campaigns. They must also provide information in such a way that a potential consumer can adequately assess their chances of winning.
  • Control over the financial activities. During the licensing process, a primary control is carried out, however, additional checks can be conducted at any time. The taxes on gambling business are quite high in Denmark. There are two types of taxes – an income tax for operators (45% for the first 4 million Danish kroner, then 75% is paid, for online establishments – 20%) and a corporate tax, that is 25% of the rest.
  • Distribution of funds received as a result of state licensing and taxation. Funds are often refferred to sports and cultural programs.

If we take into account the breacking of the state monopoly on all types of gambling business, a detailed study of statistics shows that organizations, controlled by state bodies, still have been having a greater sphere of influence on the gambling services market in comparison with the private companies.

The segment of the market, directly or indirectly controlled by the state, is 62%.

Register
of the self-excluded players

In order to improve the efficiency of the fight against gambling addiction, the Danish Gambling Authority has created the ROFUS – a special register of self-excluded players. This register aims to protect Danish citizens from gambling, while registration is carried out on a voluntary basis.

Once a citizen is registered, he cannot join in both betting and online games that have been licensed. There are two forms – permanent exemption and temporary.

A temporary exclusion gives a participant the opportunity to choose by himself the period during which he will not be able to play. After this period the opportunity will be renewed automatically.

The permanent exclusion has a minimum period of one year. When this period is over, an application for deletion from the register may be submitted to the appropriate authority.

Prospects
of the gambling business in Denmark

As of 2016, the amount of income from all types of the government-regulated gambling is about $ 1.33 billion. If we calculate this amount in relation to the entire population of Denmark over 18 years old, it will amount to $ 295 or 2000 Danish crowns.

After the liberalization of legislation in 2010, the gaming services market shows rather slow, but stable increase. If the legislation is not changed in the future, such trends will continue.

However, the latest amendments to the legislation in 2014 caused outrage of the state's European partners, so the chance of the new amendments to the legislation is still possible, and all owners of gambling organizations know it.

Banking license in Vanuatu

Banking license in Vanuatu. Financial flows, lending activities, the complex of monetary and banking operations – it is profitable for the banking development. Opening a bank in Europe is a rather difficult procedure. An alternative of a banking license obtaining is the Pacific Republic of Vanuatu in Melanesia.

The Security License of Vanuatu bring benefits for business in the financial sphere, it covers Forex activities. This jurisdiction is profitable for the offshore company establishment, opening a foreign bank account for an external economic activity.

The main principles of the jurisdiction are transparency and simplicity of the offshore activities in accordance with international standards.

The activities of banks are regulated by the Financial Institutions Act of November 2, 1999. According to the legislation, a bank is regulated as a party who:

coordinates the processes of the bonds, certificates, securities flows with individuals or legal entities, using the income from these operations (totally or part of it) for crediting and investment;
carries out the financial investments accepting from individuals with withdrawal on-demand or upon expiration of the term.

Who is responsible for the decision
to issue a license for a bank opening?

The decision on a license assignment to a particular bank should be made by the Minister. All documents for a license registration are prepared and submitted by a licensing agent. An ordinary person who comes to Vanuatu will not be able to get a license by himself. He needs a help of a licensing agent who organizes the transfer of documents.

What is required to apply for a banking license
in the Republic of Vanuatu?

In order to apply for a banking license, you must:

  • provide the confirmation of an authorized capital in the amount from 500 thousand US dollars for opening a financial organization;
  • have a physical office, registered in the territory of the Republic;
  • draw up a detailed business plan, with the defining of goals and ways to achieve them; it should be prepared by a professional financier;
  • give the copies of identity documents of bank beneficiaries, that are carefully checked by the state authorities of Vanuatu;
  • set up a professional team of employees with a banking education; specialists of our company can help to find a solution in this case;
  • provide an annual accounting support, that costs 16 thousand US dollars;
  • pay for the license once a year;
  • organize and adopt an accounting for the financial flows, according to the ministerial rules and accounting requirements.

After the entire set of documents is prepared, you should make a request to the Reserve Bank of the Republic of Vanuatu. In order to have it done, you should:

  • pay all state fees;
  • give a written application for permission to grant a license to the organization, registered in the island;
  • provide all valid and truthful information.

An application is reviewed within four months.

Commission Fees –
Vanuatu Banking License

The price of a banking structure establishment in Vanuatu includes a state duty, the commission fees for the licensee agent services, an office renting in the territory of Republic, the staff employment, etc. All calculations can be made at a privat consultation.

The duty is levied annually for payment of the founding company. The bank cannot be registered without such company.

Why do License Applications get rejected?

The Reserve Bank may refuse the licensee if:

  • the organization does not legally exist;
  • it is not profitable to the Republic economy;
  • the financial flows for the authorized capital confirmation are contrary to the legislation, their background is criminal or unclear;
  • the identity documents of the shareholders or the Founding Director are unsatisfactory;
  • an internal control, an accounting, a risk regulation of a legal entity do not meet the requirements of the Minister;
  • the operation of the owning bank or the admitted joint stock company is unacceptable;
  • the amount of payments has not been totally fulfilled, as the legislation of Vanuatu requires, for the bank it is VT 200 million, for the creditor company – 100 million VT.
An action course of a license
obtaining procedure for the banking sector

Firstly, in order to start the license obtaining process, you should seek an advice of the specialists, experienced in this area.

Secondly, the initial formation of the organization and the cost of the license on the island territory will be 150 thousand EUR.

Thirdly, it is necessary to provide a set of official documents and establish a company in the Republic of Vanuatu.

The founders or beneficiaries provide:

  • The copies of the foreign passports certified by a notary;
  • A proof of registration – it can be a notarized copy of the utility bill, an extract from the bank about the account existence, indicating the owner's address, the validity of this document is at most 3 months at the time of submission the documents for a license;
  • A resume in English;
  • A Police Clearance Certificate;
  • A business plan;
  • An application for a banking license purchasing.

Investment banking license in Labuan

Investment banking license in Labuan. Labuan borders with Malaysia on the east, the South China Sea on the south and the Brunei Bay on the north. It is a part of the federal territory of Malaysia and consists of one large and six small islands.

Labuan Investment Banking Business under the Labuan Financial Services Securities Act, 2010 (LFSSA) means:

Providing with the credit funds;
Support with the consulting services on corporate and investment issues or making an investment on behalf of any person;
Conducting the foreign currency transactions, the interest rate swaps, the transactions with derivatives or financial derivatives or any other similar risks management activities;
Labuan Islamic Investment Banking Business;
Management of funds, with the permission of the Minister, can be in any currency other than the Malaysian currency.
Labuan Investment Banks are not allowed to accept deposits.

In accordance with the LFSSA regulations and the Foreign Exchange Control Act, 1953 (ECM), a licensed investment bank Labuan are able to transact in the Malaysian ringgit and with Malaysian residents.

Eligibility
for the Labuan License

Labuan Investment Bank can be established as a branch or subsidiary and registered under the Labuan Companies Act, 1990. The application can be accepted from:

  • An investment bank or investment banking group licensed by the regulatory authority at the country of origin;
  • A licensed bank or designated financial institution or financial service supplier, controlled by a competent regulatory authority;
  • Any licensed institution under the BAFIA with prior permission from the Bank Negara Malaysia; and also
  • Corporations with the requisite financial experience and expertise, with good results, with a track record of at least 3 years and regulated by an authority in their countries.
Approval Requirements –
Labuan Investment Banking License

The applicant company submits an application from the head office / parent company and assumes all responsibility caused by the activities of its branch or subsidiary in Labuan;

  • The applicant company must submit a business plan for the first 3 years of work;
  • The applicant company must also submit the verified annual reports for 3 pre-app years;
  • The request, where it is relevant, must be verified by a letter confirmation from the regulatory authority;
  • The controller or director/CEO of the applicant company must meet the requirements.

The appointment of the subsidiary's board of directors also requires a prior approval from the Labuan FSA.

Timelines –
Labuan Investment Banking License

The term, excluding the time for opening a bank account – 6-12 months + delivery time, depending on the provided documents.

The minimum paid capital is 10 million RMB (or equivalent in any other currency).
Opening a bank account – 3-4 weeks (depending on the client's documents, type of activity and the validity period of the bank reference letter).

Allowed currencies are any other but the Malaysian ringgit.

Company structure – Investment banking license in Labuan

The founders – from 1 shareholder (there can only be the legal entities, without restrictions on citizenship or place of residence)

The directors – at least 2 directors (they can only be the natural persons, without restrictions on citizenship or place of residence).

After a license is obtained, you must establish a local office (without requirements for its size or location), have at least 3 local employees and a local phone number. Physical presence of at least 1 Operations Manager, 1 Compliance Officer, and 1 Accountant.

Procedure
and requirements

We will complete all the steps for you. You need only to provide the following documents:

  • Certified copies of the directors and shareholders passports (2 sets);
  • Certified utility bill from the direct directors and shareholders (2 sets). An account or bank statement;
  • A recommendation letter from the bank;
  • A bank statement confirmation of the bank balance for the shareholder – balance should be at least 500,000 MYR (about 123,000 US dollars);
  • All documents must be scanned for initial verification;
  • After verification has been done, the documents should be sent in original;
  • The payment is made for the complete process;
  • other necessary documents may be requested additionally;
  • An annex will be processed by the LFSA license.

A conditional approval is given once the capital requirement has been met (a Company capital of $ 123,000; after the capital has been deposited, you can withdraw it for use)

The Capital can be taken away for using, but the capital amount must be not lower than the minimum. If the capital amount becomes less than minimum, the bank may close the account and the LFSA, therefore refuse / terminate the license.

  • After an initial approval has been carried out, the client is required to pay a deposit of £ 5,000 annually.
  • Passport of an authorized person on behalf of the corporation (a copy certified by an authorized attorney, a notary or an embassy);
  • Utility bill of an authorized person on behalf of the corporation (a copy should be certified by an authorized attorney, a notary or an embassy);
  • The latest education and work experience confirmation of an authorized person for a corporate authority;
  • M&A includes a regulation for the establishment of a Labuan company or permission to implement;
  • 2 Referral letters for an authorized person, that must be issued by a professional such as a lawyer, accountant, company secretary or bank of an authorized person for a corporate authority;
  • The company registers with the information about the name of director, shareholder, auditor, company secretary (a certified copy by the Company Secretary);
  • Certificate of incorporation (for authentication by the Company Secretary);
  • Certificate of the Registered Office Address;
  • Resolution for appointment of an authorized person on behalf of the company (a certified copy by the Company Secretary);

Board Resolution to Invest Funds to the Labuan Company;

  • Structure of the corporate block of shares, including the applicant;
  • Certified document that confirms the license issuance, provided by the relevant entities of the state of origin – if it is relevant;
  • Statement of objection to the subsidiary or branch establishment in Labuan;
  • Confirmation that the applicant is a shareholder or head of an office;

  • Copies of three-year financial statements/annual statements

and reporting
